event.location: A bus carrying soldiers from Jerusalem to Shilo.
event.summary: 10/04/1993: A Palestinian driving a car packed with explosives blew himself up in a suicide attack on an Israeli commuter bus outside the Israeli Army headquarters in the West Bank. Thirty passengers were wounded.
event.target1: Egged Bus (Route No. 175), carrying IDF Soldiers
event.gname: Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine (PFLP)
event.motive: The attack was perpetrated in an effort to derail peace talks.
event.addnotes: The suicide bomber blew up his car next to a bus carrying Israeli soldiers. Palestinian authorities said the man was a member of the PFLP, but Hamas also claimed responsibility.
event.scite1: Clyde Haberman, “30 Israelis Hurt by Suicide Bomber,” The New York Times, October 5, 1993.
event.scite2: Jon Immanuel, “Suicide Bomber Wounds 30,” The Jerusalem Post, October 5, 1993.
event.scite3: David Horovitz, “Car Bomb Injures 30 Israelis,” Financial Times, October 5, 1993.
